author: Staff Reporter
text:
Danasegar S., an artist from Puducherry, explores how experiences are affected and mutilated by being gendered. His solo painting exhibition is on at Tasmai, a Centre for Art and Culture in Puducherry from January 27 to February 21.

A graduate from the Bharathiar Palkalai Koodam, he works on the influence of change in gendered roles and on our perceptions.

He has been freelancing in Puducherry and his paintings have been exhibited regularly abroad. His paintings exploring compositions with self-portrait, abstracts and paintings in more expressionistic style and he successfully moves from one style to another, mainly using oil colours sometimes acrylics and water colour. The artist through oil paintings and water colour recreates himself, time and again. Mr. Danasegar use his canvases as a ‘statement’ to prove that all are made up of the same and the same consists of all and spares nobody. The artist says that nature is not to be totally represented because abstraction is as much subjective as it can be objective.

His works invite the gaze and sight to experience rather than enjoy, to self introspect more than empathise.
title: Reflections on gendered roles
